text: Gordonsville is an unincorporated community in Shell Rock Township, Freeborn County, Minnesota, United States. It is southeast of Albert Lea, along U.S. Highway 65. ==History== A post office was established at Gordonsville in 1862, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1965. The community derives its name from T. J. Gordon and W. H. H. Gordon, father and son, who both served as early postmasters. Gordonsville was platted in 1880. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Freeborn County, Minnesota Category:1862 establishments in Minnesota Category:Unincorporated communities in Minnesota
title: Gordonsville, Minnesota
